newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai grain market turnover hits 854 bln yuan.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai grain market turnover hits 854 bln yuan.

text.p: Total turnover on the Shanghai Cereals and Oils Exchange has hit 854 billion yuan in the four years since it opened, the Shanghai Securities News said on Saturday.
The exchange, opened in late June 1993, had become an important venue for Chinese companies to hedge their products and discover appropriate prices, the newspaper said.
The exchange had traded 74.6 million lots of futures contracts including rice, beans, wheat, barley and rapeseed oil, with a combined weight of 373 million tonnes, it said.
The exchange had 133 members, it said.
